You feel the presence of a soul, twisting and sinuous. It notices you, too, and draws nearer.

Its restless essence tingles against your own. It is searching. Hunting.

You recognize it as the soul of a nāga.
"Stay a little longer. Your glow is a comfort here."
[Leave.]
"I'll restore the adra pillar. Then you can continue on your way."

"The way? I am searching for a way. Show me." 

She melts into the ether and becomes a quiet presence beside you.
"What is this? Come closer. You glow so brightly. Just like the... the..." The soul recoils from a memory of violence like a child snatching her hand from a hot stove.
"What were you searching for?"
"The striped fiends profane the island! Endlessly burrowing, building. They bury the adra under stone!"
"A way." Memory blooms at her core. A burst of vehemence shudders through her essence.
"Sugaan says we must find a way in. Sugaan says I must find a way in." There is warmth in this thought. Pride.
"You're a scout."
"Then what?"

"The fiends gather at the walls. Searching, too. Not for me, but they see me still."

You feel a prickle of sympathetic pain, as if pierced by a volley of bullets.
"I am Yanass. Yanass searches."
"No! Not dead. Still searching." A desperate, dissonant ripple thrums through the nāga's soul.
"You died."
"What are you looking for now?"

"A way, I said! A glowing, shining way."

As she speaks, you feel yourself pulled into her memory and into the dark abyss of the In-Between.

You remember it from your own brief sojourn there.
"Do not go. It is so dark here." Her voice fades to a forlorn whisper as you withdraw.
Yet from the darkness you - and Yanass - see a bright rift. A pillar with roots that seem to reach into the heart of the world.

"The way glows. Like an angler fish lure. But it feels safe."

It does. You are drawn to it.

Another glowing figure appears, this one shaped like an enormous walker. 

Three stars burn above its brow. 

You feel Yanass' fear at this walker-thing, even as you recognize it as Eothas.
[Drift toward it.]
[Draw back.]

You watch as the glowing figure approaches the pillar. It reaches out, and a violent current rips through the darkness. 

You hear a chorus of screams, but they sound distant and distorted, as if coming from underwater. Light and energy flow into the strange being from the pillar and from a hundred points gathered around it.

At last the pillar is dark. The glowing walker recedes, brighter than before.

Everything is dark.

"I will follow the way, I think. But then I see another glowing-thing.

"This one does not feel safe."
"Now there is no way and no light. I am afraid."
"Come with me."
"It is too dark. I will lose my way. Or be swallowed by the terrible walker." Fear shivers through her.
You recognize this as an adra pillar.
"You know Sugaan? Maybe you could reason with him for me."
"Sugaan? He sent me after a way. But he is not here in the darkness. Only you."
"Please do not go."
Confusion clouds her essence like sediment stirred at the bottom of a marsh.

"You know what it is, to roam, to seek distant places. Yes, I feel this in you.

"Your feet, your eyes, they find the way."

She melts into the ether and becomes a quiet presence beside you.
"Who is Sugaan?"

"Speaker for the gods. Grandfather to many.

"He leads us here, and here I must find a way. In."
"A seeker cannot search whilst standing still. The way lies forward."

"You, who amble and wander?

"I feel it in you. You drift through life like flotsam on the tides. I cannot lose my way."
